parameters: Hmm, no. I don't think "Diary" is the right word. Developmental log, perhaps? Yes, let's go with that.

Kind of a mouthful, but I'm keeping it. Now, where was I? Right, at the start. The higher ups have given me another dungeon to run. Frankly, I have no clue why, as I generally just designed the last one to facilitate my own kinks, and then let the first adventurer to reach me shut the thing down. However, if they're going to give me their resources to set up more orgies, then by the Goddess, that's what I'm going to do!

It's not signed with an author, but that's clearly Alexander. Unless they have logs for separate dungeons ran by someone who just so happens to have the exact same interests as him. It doesn't, however, have a door code. So that's nice\..\..\..

Woah, those are some \filoud\fi footsteps. Are they getting\..\..\.. louder? Hmm, perhaps you'll have to be a bit more selective in your search. If this entire library is full of Alexander's diary entries, then you certainly don't want to have to riffle through all of it anyways.
Hmm, no. I don't think "Diary" is the right word. Developmental log, perhaps? Yes, let's go with that.

Kind of a mouthful, but I'm keeping it. Now, where was I? Right, at the start. The higher ups have given me another dungeon to run. Frankly, I have no clue why, as I generally just designed the last one to facilitate my own kinks, and then let the first adventurer to reach me shut the thing down. However, if they're going to give me their resources to set up more orgies, then by the Goddess, that's what I'm going to do!

Tch, there's a bell on the inside of the door, going off as you enter. Hopefully nobody heard that\..\..\.. Now, let's see about finding that door code in here\..\..\.. Oh, what the \fifuck.\fi The room is just a giant library? Well, perhaps not \figiant,\fi but still annoyingly large for you to have to search through. Damn. Well, nothing to do but start looking, you suppose.
The bell rings, but the librarian is out of commission, granting you free reign to rummage about.

The golems are coming along nicely. I know I said my main desire in designing them was to have something emotionlessly milk adventurer's dry, and I stand by that statement, but doing that for the entire dungeon would be get a bit dull. Therefore, I've started giving some of them personalities as well. Like the giant maid golem that's designed to manage adventurer's sexual needs, but really just enjoys forcing them to orgasm in humiliating ways. Lucky adventurer's, Goddess I wish that were me... Of course, I'll be testing the golems on myself, but being the designer takes a bit of the spice away from it, you know?

Fuck me. As if that intern scrambling my \fientire\fi dungeon wasn't enough, now there's a new room, more of a viewing platform, really, that I did \finot\fi design. That's a bit creepy, but I could chalk it up to the dimensional re-organization, no big deal. The \fireal\fi problem is the creepy fucking floating eye that keeps showing up when you go up there. It's a real shame too, because the view is \fiincredible.\fi I've reached out to my supervisor, Abigail, to ask about the floating eye, but all she said was "That's normal, don't worry about it." and, "Stop asking questions you don't want answers to, Alexander." Needless to say, I'm concerned. I'm going to try and keep the adventurer's away from that shit, once they start to arrive.

Okay, so that didn't work. Apparently telling adventurer's to not go somewhere is a really great way to have them go directly there. On the bright side, it seems that thing is pretty harmless. It just shows up whenever someone stares out into the void long enough, and does... whatever creepy shit it does, exactly. I suppose I'll just cautiously warn people that it might be in their best interest not to wait too long up there.

Somehow, the higher ups caught wind of my tongue hypersensitivity idea for the third branch of the dungeon. I found out about this when Abigail suddenly presented me a Succubus, and told me \fiit\fi would handle the sensitivity crest application. Now, I'm going to be honest here, and say that sounded like a fantastic idea. Succubi \fiare\fi experts at such things, and the opportunity to study her techniques would be a delight. The only problem is that she's creepy as fuck. Being charmed by her is certainly effective, but there was something unnerving about the process. She won't let me watch said process, or give me any information about it, either. \fiQuite\fi unhelpful, I must say. Oh well. I'll just have to keep an eye on that one...
1 onahole. You see where I'm going with these, yes?
Third and fourth digits of the door code are 7 and 3, in that order.
55 gallons of lube. No, you can't ask why.
10 000 gold. (I'm just seeing if I can slip this one in, honestly.)

There's a Vampire here now. I don't know when that happened, but she's apparently mad about her room being reshuffled to a new section of the dungeon. Hello? \fiHer\fi room? When did she get a room? \fiWhere\fi did she get a room? I apologized for the room reshuffling, but don't have a solution. She wasn't pleased about that, but was generally quite polite, and perked up when I mentioned a bunch of adventurer's with hypersensitive tongues would be coming her way. I suppose she can stay.

\..\..\..? There's nobody out here? Was that a ghost making those footsteps? They didn't sound very close to the room though; you probably could have spent more time looking around in there before making your escape. Assuming that \fiwasn't\fi a ghost.

\..\..\..? There's nobody out here? Was that a ghost making those footsteps? They sounded a bit close, but you probably could have spent a \fibit\fi more time looking around in there before escaping. Assuming that \fiwasn't\fi a ghost.

\..\..\..? There's nobody out here? Was that a ghost making those footsteps? They sounded like they were just outside the door, too. You suppose you can go back in and look around more, as long as you don't let those footsteps reach you...
Still no sign of anyone. The footsteps were pretty far away, too. You had plenty of time to keep searching.

Still no sign of anyone. The footsteps were getting a tad close, but you're pretty sure you still got out of there with some time to spare. Could have looked a bit longer, if you're willing to push your luck.
Still no sign of anyone. Those footsteps were \ficlose\fi though. You got out with only moments to spare, but that let you look around plenty, too.

\fi\c[25]The librarian won't return after being defeated, even if you leave the dungeon and return. You can choose to fight her again, or just view her loss scene, here. No stat changes will occur regardless of your choice, though if you lose you will consume a linking charge. Also, if you choose to fight, her health will be full.

\c[9]"\fiTsk,\fi how rude. Getting caught where you don't belong, and then not having the decency to lose to me? Quite uncouth, honestly."

\.\.\c[0]

\c[4]"I kind of have to be in here to figure out the code to get \fiout\fi of the dungeon, so I'm really not sorry in the slightest."

\.\.\c[0]
